nodes.text: This seems to be the "How to" section of the library. It's got a lot of books on various skills and ways to do things.

options.text: Study the Book on Making Friends

nodes.text: This looks like it could be useful - "You Can Woo, Too - How to Make Friends and Find True Love!"
... And the most important tip about making friends? 'Be there for them.' Seems like an easy thing to do -  just helping them when they need it.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
Maybe I can learn something more about making friends...
The book says that you need to do things together that your friend feels is important. That makes sense.
The book emphasizes taking the opportunity to spend more time with your friend. Maybe I should read less and do more with others.
It said to be more complimentary and less judgmental. Seems reasonable.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
This looks interesting - "Dare to Do the Derring-Do"
It's all about not letting your fears get in the way of your accomplishments - and about getting things done.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
Maybe I can learn something more about derring-do...
The book says that you should "never give up, never surrender, full speed ahead."
The book emphasizes using willpower to accomplish any goal. Huh, that sounds a lot like moxie.
It's all about daring to be different and doing what you want to do no matter what others say.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.

options.text: Study Zen and the Art of the Throw

nodes.text: Thomas said that there was a book on throwing. It must be in here somewhere...
Found it!
What do you know? You can learn something about throwing by reading a book.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
I guess I'll have to practice what this book preaches to improve.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
Where is that book Thomas mentioned about ropes...
Ah, there is is - Ropes and Schemes. Maybe it would be useful.
Huh... there's more to climbing a rope or throwing a grapnel than I realized.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
Maybe I can learn something else from this book.
Looks like the only way I can improve my climbing skills more is by practice, practice, practice.
I'll have to pick that book up some other time.
At least it wasn't as boring as a Geography lesson.
Eh, maybe another day...
Combat Dummies for Dummies? Who would buy a book that insults them right on the cover? These won't sell.
I've seen this one before. It's all about how to discover what kind of lifetime of toil and misery you'd hate the least. It's called What Color is Your Pair of Shoes?.

This is a big one, with a lot of illustrations: The Attraction of Rappelling. It teaches a lot of fancy rappelling techniques... oh, and it's by Cirque du Sardonia! They're that band of evil clowns who put on a brilliant show of ropework for the crowds every time they break into someone's home!
Huh! They even teach how to rappel with another person, and ideally achieve simultaneous climb acts!
